ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes because it's a class where you spend a lot of time learning not only the academic findings and literature, but also the real world policy implications as well.
I would recommend this course if you are interested in anything to do with guns. You will learn a lot, and the professors are great mentors.
Everything you thought you "knew" about guns is probably not entirely right.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was great because we ended with viewing gun violence as a public health issue, and took a public health approach to addressing gun violence issues. I also had the opportunity to delve into the topic of gun crime and mental illness for my final paper, which was invaluable to my knowledge of public health/mental health.
